intro: Hebanthe erianthos, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silky hebanthe, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom during the warmer months. Hebanthe erianthos is native to Central and South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and indoor plant collections.
